result.execSummary:
The defendant Lois Ann Price was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Lois Ann Price is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Lois Ann Price was found guilty of Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription [Modifiers: Penalty-Fraud/Obtaining Prescriptions], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Amended Information filed by Atty Long

1:19 P.M., Defendant Lois Ann Price in court with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Amended Information filed, waives reading, Rights/Elements, Defendant pleads no contest to Ct. 2, Judgment to be entered, Ct. 1 dismissed, Court withholds sentence, probation 1 year, $443.00 costs, any other conditions agent deems necessary, defendant to submit DNA Sample, 1:30 P.M.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 02-22-2016 01:00 pm

Defendant Lois Ann Price in court with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Information filed, reading waived. Defendant stood mute. Court entered not guilty plea. Bond continued. Atty. Riek requested case be set for argued plea/sentencing

Defendant Lois Ann Price in court with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Crystal Long  appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over.

Defendant Lois Ann Price in court with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Clifford Chase Burdon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Riek requested preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 7, 2016 at 09:00 am.
